intro: Pedicularis wallichioides, commonly known as the alpine lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. This plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, often in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations. Its flowers are usually pink to purple, with a distinctive spurred shape that aids in pollination by insects. It is a herbaceous perennial that thrives in cool, moist environments with limited sunlight.
